item.title: Transforming Tomorrow: The Rise of AI in the Workplace
item.content:encoded: Transforming Tomorrow: The Rise of AI in the Workplace

item.title: The Bad Guys Have AI, Too
item.content:encoded: The Bad Guys Have AI, Too

item.title: Current State of the AI VC Financing Market
item.content:encoded: While the broader venture capital financing market continues to experience headwinds and turbulence, artificial intelligence (AI) deal activity has been a bright spot for companies and investors, with relatively robust deal activity and sustained investor interest, which are expected to continue into 2025.

item.title: MoFo Tech Law Summit – Tech and Antitrust: Policy Shifts in the Second Trump Administration
item.content:encoded: Tech companies have faced an increasingly complex antitrust landscape in the U.S. and abroad. During the Biden administration, under the leadership of FTC Chair Lina Khan and Department of Justice Antitrust Division AAG Jonathan Kanter, the antitrust agencies pursued an aggressive antitrust enforcement agenda across all fronts, focusing their scrutiny on Big Tech acquisitions and bringing conduct cases.

item.title: MoFo Tech Law Summit – Responsible Tech: Policy Becomes Practice
item.content:encoded: MoFo Tech Law Summit – Responsible Tech: Policy Becomes Practice

item.title: AI Dynamics: Regulatory Landscape and Industry Insights
item.content:encoded: AI Dynamics: Regulatory Landscape and Industry Insights

item.title: 2024 Tech M&A Survey
item.content:encoded: Morrison Foerster is pleased to share with our clients and friends the results of our 2024 Tech M&A Survey, published in conjunction with Mergermarket. Mergermarket surveyed 300 dealmakers from around the world in order to gain valuable insights into the future of technology-related M&A.

item.title: Introducing the MoFo Tech Law Summit – Innovation Under Regulation
item.content:encoded: Introducing the MoFo Tech Law Summit – Innovation Under Regulation

item.title: USPTO Guidance: Artificial Intelligence Inventions That Solve a Technical Problem Eligible for Patenting
item.content:encoded: USPTO Guidance: Artificial Intelligence Inventions That Solve a Technical Problem Eligible for Patenting

item.title: U.S. Senate AI Working Group Publishes AI Policy Roadmap
item.content:encoded: On May 15th, after nearly a year of study, the Bipartisan U.S. Senate AI Working Group released its Roadmap for Artificial Intelligence (AI) Policy in the United States Senate.

item.title: USPTO Guidance: Inventions Made with AI Assistance Can Be Patent-Eligible
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) has issued guidance regarding patentability and inventorship for inventions made with the assistance of artificial intelligence (AI), clarifying the Office’s position that such inventions are patent-eligible so long as at least one human inventor made a significant contribution to conception of the invention.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - The “Abstract Ideas” Behind Artificial Intelligence Inventions
item.content:encoded: The evolution of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies has triggered a surge in the filings of patent applications, from machine learning models to applications of those models.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to Generate Richer Outputs
item.content:encoded: In 2023, generative AI took center stage—the year was filled with rapid advancements in the capabilities of large language models (LLMs). Heading into 2024, businesses continue to see great potential for generative AI and are eager to integrate the technology into internal workflows and customer-facing applications.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - EU Copyright Law: AI Act on the Home Stretch
item.content:encoded: Generative artificial intelligence (“GenAI”) challenges EU copyright law, from the AI training to the protectability and liability risks of its output. The EU’s forthcoming AI Act takes first steps towards AI-specific regulation with its provider obligations on training data transparency and copyright policy.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - Responsible AI isn't just for Big Tech
item.content:encoded: Responsible AI isn’t just for BigTech. This coming year we can expect institutional, venture, and strategic investors to take an interest in whether and how well their funds and portfolio companies are identifying and managing the legal and ethical risks associated with their use of AI and, in particular, Generative AI.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - IRS Adopts AI-Powered Audit Selection Tools, Hires Technology-Focused Leadership
item.content:encoded: On December 13, 2023, the IRS revealed a revamped leadership structure, introducing Chief Information Officer and Chief Operating Officer positions to leverage technology more effectively.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - Voluntary Commitments by Companies to Responsible AI
item.content:encoded: Generative artificial intelligence exploded into public consciousness in 2023. With increased public awareness inevitably came increased regulatory scrutiny, both in the United States and abroad. While there is little doubt that government regulation of AI will increase in 2024, a different trend is also emerging – AI companies proactively embracing responsible AI principles through voluntary commitments.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - Vendor Procurement Practices and Generative AI
item.content:encoded: Vendor procurement practices will continue to evolve in 2024 to reflect corporate AI risk management and governance policies. While companies are beginning to appreciate that vendor work product may be developed using AI tools unless their contracts specify otherwise, they have not fully appreciated what that means for their businesses.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - AI: Product or Service? Product Liability in the Age of AI
item.content:encoded: Courts are increasingly being asked: is AI a product or a service? AI companies currently operate within an undefined products liability space. As companies continue to innovate with AI, courts must grapple with complicated questions in cases involving AI technologies.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - U.S. Laws Will Focus on the Use of AI in Hiring
item.content:encoded: As the use of AI in hiring and employment practices grows, U.S. states are increasingly regulating such use.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - U.S. State Consumer Privacy Laws’ Focus on Automated Decision-Making and Profiling
item.content:encoded: AI Trends For 2024 - U.S. State Consumer Privacy Laws’ Focus on Automated Decision-Making and Profiling

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - Privacy Regulators Will Increase Scrutiny of Data Collection for AI Training
item.content:encoded: Privacy regulators, including the EU data protection authorities (EU DPAs), are expected to increase their scrutiny of data scraping to train AI algorithms. Data scraping involves the collection of large amounts of publicly available information, which may trigger obligations under privacy laws.

item.title: AI Trends For 2024 - EU DPAs Will Apply Requirements of the EU AI Act
item.content:encoded: EU data protection authorities (DPAs) will likely start enforcing the requirements of the EU AI Act, the world’s first comprehensive AI regulation, despite the Act likely not entering into full force until 2026.

item.title: AI Executive Order – Patent Issues
item.content:encoded: President Biden’s Executive Order on the Safe, Secure, and Trustworthy Development and Use of Artificial Intelligence was issued on November 1, 2023, and has made waves throughout the AI industry. Morrison Foerster has been reviewing the executive order (EO) and considering its impact in several legal areas.

item.title: What's the Forecast for Tech M&A?
item.content:encoded: Morrison Foerster is pleased to share with our clients and friends the results of our 2023 Tech M&A Survey, published in conjunction with Mergermarket. Mergermarket surveyed 300 dealmakers from around the world in order to gain valuable insights into the future of technology-related M&A.

item.title: Top 10 Considerations in Licensing Cleantech Innovations
item.content:encoded: Spurred by both planetary and economic needs, the industry commonly referred to as “cleantech”—short for “clean technology”—has been on the rise.

item.title: High Walls and Small Gardens: Biden Administration Unveils Outbound Investment Screening
item.content:encoded: On August 9, 2023, President Biden issued a long-anticipated executive order (EO) to address investments by U.S. persons in companies that engage with certain categories of technology and products located in the People’s Republic of China.

item.title: AI Leaders Commit to White House Supported Guidelines
item.content:encoded: In coordination with the White House, several leaders in the artificial intelligence (AI) space have publicly committed to a voluntary set of guidelines relating to responsible development and deployment of AI.

item.title: Generative AI and Copyright: Roundtable Series Recap
item.content:encoded: Throughout April, Morrison Foerster sponsored and participated in a series of roundtable discussions hosted by Creative Commons regarding generative AI and copyright. The roundtables—in Boston, New York, and San Francisco—brought together in-house counsel from companies developing generative AI tools, scholars, business leaders, and nonprofit advisors.

item.title: New York City AI Law: Trials, Tribulations, And Uncertainties
item.content:encoded: New York City (NYC) is the first U.S. jurisdiction to pass an expansive law regulating the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in hiring. Local Law 144 of 2021 (LL144) prohibits employers and employment agencies from using an automated employment decision tool (AEDT) to make employment decisions for job candidates in New York City, unless:

item.title: FDA Publishes Draft Guidance for Predetermined Change Control Plan for AI/ML-Enabled Device Software Functions
item.content:encoded: On April 3, 2023, FDA released the draft guidance titled “Marketing Submission Recommendations for a Predetermined Change Control Plan for Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML)-Enabled Device Software Functions” (hereinafter “draft guidance”) proposing an approach to support iterative improvement through modifications to a machine learning device software function (ML-DSF) while continuing to provide reasonable assurance of device safety and effectiveness. FDA is accepting comments on the draft guidance until July 3, 2023.

item.title: 10 Considerations When Licensing AI For Drug Discovery
item.content:encoded: Stephanie Sharron, Annalisa Cooper, and Wolfgang Schoenig, with assistance from Robert Grohmann, authored an article for Law360 explaining the top ten considerations when licensing AI for drug discovery.

item.title: Key Issues in Generative AI Transactions
item.content:encoded: Over the past year, we have seen a dramatic increase in the adoption of AI technologies across industries. Because transactions involving AI technologies can resemble those involving traditional software, like SaaS agreements, parties often assume that their expectations from those standard agreements about what is reasonable and “market” should also apply to AI-related technology transactions.

item.title: Responsible AI as Part of a Company's ESG Framework
item.content:encoded: Suz Mac Cormac, Stephanie Sharron, and Oluwabamise Onabanjo authored an article for the Daily Journal explaining how Responsible AI (artificial intelligence) practices in combination with Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) frameworks can be applied both to mitigate risk and support a corporation's ESG goals.

item.title: Generative AI and Copyright: Conference Recap
item.content:encoded: On March 24, thought leaders in the technology and entertainment industries gathered in Los Angeles and virtually for Creative Commons’ Disruption Conference. The daylong event, which was sponsored by Morrison Foerster, focused on how the rights of content creators are being transformed as generative AI goes mainstream.

item.title: GPT-4 Release: Briefing on Model Improvements and Limitations
item.content:encoded: On March 14, 2023, OpenAI—a MoFo client—released GPT-4, which quickly garnered broad media coverage. For those assessing the opportunities and risks related to GPT-4

item.title: Copyright Office Denies Claim to Copyright in Generative AI Images
item.content:encoded: The U.S. Copyright Office has denied an attempt to register copyright in images created using the Midjourney generative AI tool. The reasoning of its decision sharply limits the potential paths to receiving copyright in images created using generative AI tools, even where that output is generated in response to a prompt containing substantial textual authorship.

item.title: ISDA Digital Asset Derivatives Update
item.content:encoded: On 26 January 2023, the International Swaps and Derivatives Association, Inc. (ISDA) published new standard documentation for the trading of digital asset derivatives (the Digital Asset Definitions), and a whitepaper titled Navigating Bankruptcy in Digital Asset Markets: Netting and Collateral Enforceability (the Whitepaper) that addresses certain legal issues in the context of bankruptcy proceedings. We set out a few key points in respect of each document below.

item.title: Cryptoasset Firms Marketing to UK Consumers Warned to Begin Preparing for Financial Promotions Regime Now
item.content:encoded: Cryptoasset Firms Marketing to UK Consumers Warned to Begin Preparing for Financial Promotions Regime Now

item.title: Webinar - Responsible AI – Ethical Dilemma Training
item.content:encoded: Webinar - Responsible AI – Ethical Dilemma Training

item.title: Are Outputs of AI Models Copyrightable?
item.content:encoded: Heather Whitney, Evangeline Phang, Tessa Schwartz, and Aaron Rubin authored an article for Law360 covering whether the outputs of generative artificial intelligence tools are copyrightable.

item.title: AI Trends for 2023 - Public Attention to AI Will Continue to Rise
item.content:encoded: While the use of AI tools is not new, public awareness of, and debate around, these tools will continue to increase as these tools become more widely available. Talk of AI and in particular generative AI is now ubiquitous in mainstream news media and on social media sites.

item.title: AI Trends for 2023 - Increased Government Scrutiny of AI
item.content:encoded: Both domestically and internationally, in 2023 we expect to see continued government scrutiny and regulation of AI tools and their use.
